info.title: Marketing Emails
info.x-hubspot-api-use-case: You want to programmatically create marketing emails, then retrieve their send statistics at a later time.
info.x-hubspot-introduction: Use the marketing email API to create, manage, and retrieve details about marketing emails. You can also this use API to retrieve statistics related to email sends, similar to what you can see in HubSpot.

get.description: The results can be filtered, allowing you to find a specific set of emails. See the table below for a full list of filtering options.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: The cursor token value to get the next set of results. You can get this from the `paging.next.after` JSON property of a paged response containing more results.

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: Specifies whether to return archived emails. Defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: createdAfter
parameters.description: Only return emails created after the specified time.

parameters.name: createdAt
parameters.description: Only return emails created at exactly the specified time.

parameters.name: createdBefore
parameters.description: Only return emails created before the specified time.

parameters.name: includeStats
parameters.description: Include statistics with emails.

parameters.name: isPublished
parameters.description: Filter by published/draft emails. All emails will be returned if not present.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return. Default is 100.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Specifies which fields to use for sorting results. Valid fields are `name`, `createdAt`, `updatedAt`, `createdBy`, `updatedBy`. `createdAt` will be used by default.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Email types to be filtered by. Multiple types can be included. All emails will be returned if not present.

parameters.name: updatedAfter
parameters.description: Only return emails last updated after the specified time.

parameters.name: updatedAt
parameters.description: Only return emails last updated at exactly the specified time.

parameters.name: updatedBefore
parameters.description: Only return emails last updated before the specified time.

body.html:
Hi {{contact.firstname}},

This is an example of an email in HubSpot. You can add and format text, include your own images, and even personalize the message with details about the recipient, like their {{contact.company}} or {{contact.city}}.

In HubSpot, the Email tool is closely linked with the Lists and Workflows tools. You can create a list of recipients on the "Sending" tab up above. If you want this email to be part of a nurturing series, you can make it part of a workflow.

Need help? Check out the documentation on creating an email, creating a list, or creating a workflow.

Something Powerful

Tell The Reader More

The headline and subheader tells us what you're offering, and the form header closes the deal. Over here you can explain why your offer is so great it's worth filling out a form for.

Remember:

  • Bullets are great
  • For spelling out benefits and
  • Turning visitors into leads.

preview_text.label: Preview Text This will be used as the preview text that displays in some email clients
preview_text.name: preview_text

post.description: Use this endpoint to create a new marketing email.

post.summary: Create an A/B test variation of a marketing email
post.description: Create a variation of a marketing email for an A/B test. The new variation will be created as a draft. If an active variation already exists, a new one won't be created.
This will create a duplicate email with the same properties as the original, with the exception of a unique ID.

get.description: Get aggregated statistics in intervals for a specified time span. Each interval contains aggregated statistics of the emails that were sent in that time.

parameters.name: emailIds
parameters.description: Filter by email IDs. Only include statistics of emails with these IDs.

parameters.name: endTimestamp
parameters.description: The end timestamp of the time span, in ISO8601 representation.

parameters.name: interval
parameters.description: The interval to aggregate statistics for.

parameters.name: startTimestamp
parameters.description: The start timestamp of the time span, in ISO8601 representation.

get.description: Use this endpoint to get aggregated statistics of emails sent in a specified time span. It also returns the list of emails that were sent during the time span.

parameters.name: emailIds
parameters.description: Filter by email IDs. Only include statistics of emails with these IDs.

parameters.name: endTimestamp
parameters.description: The end timestamp of the time span, in ISO8601 representation.

parameters.name: property
parameters.description: Specifies which email properties should be returned. All properties will be returned by default.

parameters.name: startTimestamp
parameters.description: The start timestamp of the time span, in ISO8601 representation.

get.summary: Get the details of a specified marketing email
get.description: Get the details for a marketing email.

parameters.name: emailId
parameters.description: The marketing email ID.

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: Whether to return only results that have been archived.

parameters.name: includeStats
parameters.description: Include statistics with email

delete.description: Delete a marketing email by its ID

parameters.name: emailId
parameters.description: The ID of the marketing email to delete.

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: Whether to return only results that have been archived.

patch.description: Change properties of a marketing email.

parameters.name: emailId
parameters.description: The ID of the marketing email that should get updated

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: Whether to return only results that have been archived.

requestBody.description: A marketing email object with properties that should overwrite the corresponding properties of the marketing email.

get.summary: Get the variation of a an A/B marketing email
get.description: This endpoint lets you obtain the variation of an A/B marketing email. If the email is variation A (master) it will return variation B (variant) and vice versa.

parameters.name: emailId
parameters.description: The ID of an A/B marketing email.

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: Whether to return only results that have been archived.

get.summary: Get draft version of a marketing email
get.description: Get the draft version of an email (if it exists). If no draft version exists, the published email is returned.

parameters.name: emailId
parameters.description: The marketing email ID.

patch.description: Create or update the draft version of a marketing email. If no draft exists, the system creates a draft from the current “live” email then applies the request body to that draft. The draft version only lives on the buffer—the email is not cloned.

parameters.name: emailId
parameters.description: The marketing email ID.

requestBody.description: A marketing email object with properties that should overwrite the corresponding properties in the email's current draft.

post.description: Resets the draft back to a copy of the live object.

parameters.name: emailId
parameters.description: The marketing email ID.

post.summary: Publish or send a marketing email
post.description: If you have a Marketing Hub Enterprise account or the transactional email add-on, you can use this endpoint to publish an automated email or send/schedule a regular email.

get.summary: Get revisions of a marketing email
get.description: Get a list of all versions of a marketing email, with each entry including the full state of that particular version. To view the most recent version, sort by the updatedAt parameter.

parameters.name: emailId
parameters.description: The marketing email ID.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: The cursor token value to get the next set of results. You can get this from the `paging.next.after` JSON property of a paged response containing more results.

parameters.name: before
parameters.description: The cursor token value to get the previous set of results. You can get this from the `paging.prev.before` JSON property of a paged response containing more results.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return. Default is 100.

get.summary: Get a revision of a marketing email
get.description: Get a specific revision of a marketing email.

parameters.name: emailId
parameters.description: The marketing email ID.

parameters.name: revisionId
parameters.description: The ID of a revision.

post.summary: Restore a revision of a marketing email
post.description: Restores a previous revision of a marketing email. The current revision becomes old, and the restored revision is given a new version number.

parameters.name: emailId
parameters.description: The marketing email ID.

parameters.name: revisionId
parameters.description: The ID of a revision.

post.summary: Restore a revision of a marketing email to DRAFT state
post.description: Restores a previous revision of a marketing email to DRAFT state. If there is currently something in the draft for that object, it is overwritten.

parameters.name: emailId
parameters.description: The marketing email ID.

parameters.name: revisionId
parameters.description: The ID of a revision.

post.summary: Unpublish or cancel a marketing email
post.description: If you have a Marketing Hub Enterprise account or the transactional email add-on, you can use this endpoint to unpublish an automated email or cancel a regular email. If the email is already in the process of being sent, canceling might not be possible.

suppressGraymail.description: Whether to send to unengaged contacts (false) or not (true).

PublicEmailToDetails.description: Data structure representing the to fields of the email.

CollectionResponseWithTotalVersionPublic.description: Response object for collections of marketing emails with pagination information.

activeDomain.description: The active domain of the email.

archived.description: Determines if the email is archived or not.

campaign.description: The ID of the campaign this email is associated to.

clonedFrom.description: The ID of the email this email was cloned from.

createdAt.description: The date and time of the email's creation, in ISO8601 representation.

createdById.description: The id of the user who created the email.

deletedAt.description: The date and time the email was deleted at, in ISO8601 representation.

feedbackSurveyId.description: The ID of the feedback survey linked to the email.

isPublished.description: Returns the published status of the email. This is read only.

isTransactional.description: Returns whether the email is a transactional email or not. This is read only.

name.description: The name of the email, as displayed on the email dashboard.

publishDate.description: The date and time the email is scheduled for, in ISO8601 representation. This is only used in local time or scheduled emails.

publishedAt.description: The date and time the email was published at, in ISO8601 representation.

publishedByEmail.description: Email of the user who published/sent the email.

publishedById.description: The ID of the user who published the email.

publishedByName.description: Name of the user who published the email.

sendOnPublish.description: Determines whether the email will be sent immediately on publish.

type.description: The email type, this is derived from other properties on the email such as subcategory.

updatedAt.description: The date and time of the last update to the email, in ISO8601 representation.

updatedById.description: The id of the user who last updated the email.

workflowNames.description: Names of workflows in which the email is used within a "send email" action.

content.plainTextVersion:
This is custom! View in browser ({{view_as_page_url}})

Hello {{ contact.firstname }},

Plain text emails have minimal formatting so your reader can really focus on what you have to say. Introduce yourself and explain why you’re reaching out.

Every email should try to lead the reader to some kind of action. Use this space to describe why the reader should want to click on the link below. Put the link on its own line to really draw their eye to it.

Link text

Now it’s time to wrap up your email. Before your signature, thank the recipient for reading. You can also invite them to send this email to any of their colleagues who might be interested.

All the best,

Your full name

Your job title

Other contact information

{{site_settings.company_name}}, {{site_settings.company_street_address_1}}, {{site_settings.company_street_address_2}}, {{site_settings.company_city}}, {{site_settings.company_state}} {{site_settings.company_zip}}, {{site_settings.company_country}}, {{site_settings.company_phone}}

Unsubscribe ({{unsubscribe_link_all}})

Manage preferences ({{unsubscribe_link}})

body.html:
Hello {{ contact.firstname }},

Plain text emails have minimal formatting so your reader can really focus on what you have to say. Introduce yourself and explain why you’re reaching out.

Every email should try to lead the reader to some kind of action. Use this space to describe why the reader should want to click on the link below. Put the link on its own line to really draw their eye to it.

Link text

Now it’s time to wrap up your email. Before your signature, thank the recipient for reading. You can also invite them to send this email to any of their colleagues who might be interested.

All the best,
Your full name
Your job title
Other contact information

preview_text.label: Preview Text This will be used as the preview text that displays in some email clients
preview_text.name: preview_text

contentId.description: ID of the object to test.

variationName.description: Name of the variation to be created.

AbTestCreateRequestVNext.description: Request body object for creating A/B tests.

code.description: The status code associated with the error detail

in.description: The name of the field or parameter in which the error was found.

message.description: A human readable message describing the error along with remediation steps where appropriate

subCategory.description: A specific category that contains more specific detail about the error

CollectionResponseWithTotalPublicEmailFo.description: Response object for collections of marketing emails with pagination information.

activeDomain.description: The active domain of the email.

archived.description: Determines if the email is archived or not.

businessUnitId.description: The ID of the business unit associated with the email.

campaign.description: The ID of the campaign this email is associated to.

folderIdV2.description: The ID of the folder where the email will be stored.

jitterSendTime.description: Determines whether the email send time should be randomized to avoid sending all emails at the exact same time.

language.description: The language code for the email, such as 'en' for English.

name.description: The name of the email, as displayed on the email dashboard.

publishDate.description: The date and time the email is scheduled for, in ISO8601 representation. This is only used in local time or scheduled emails.

sendOnPublish.description: Determines whether the email will be sent immediately on publish.

EmailUpdateRequest.description: Properties of a marketing email you can update via the API.

preview_text.name: preview_text

officeLocationId.description: ID of the selected office location.

PublicEmailSubscriptionDetails.description: Data structure representing the subscription fields of the email.

activeDomain.description: The active domain of the email.

archived.description: Determines if the email is archived or not.

businessUnitId.description: The ID of the business unit associated with the email.

campaign.description: The ID of the campaign this email is associated to.

feedbackSurveyId.description: The ID of the feedback survey linked to the email.

folderIdV2.description: The ID of the folder where the email will be stored.

jitterSendTime.description: Determines whether the email send time should be randomized to avoid sending all emails at the exact same time.

language.description: The language code for the email, such as 'en' for English.

name.description: The name of the email, as displayed on the email dashboard.

publishDate.description: The date and time the email is scheduled for, in ISO8601 representation. This is only used in local time or scheduled emails.

sendOnPublish.description: Determines whether the email will be sent immediately on publish.

EmailCreateRequest.description: Properties of a marketing email you can set when creating a marketing email.

Every email should try to lead the reader to some kind of action. Use this space to describe why the reader should want to click on the link below. Put the link on its own line to really draw their eye to it.

preview_text.label: Preview Text This will be used as the preview text that displays in some email clients
preview_text.name: preview_text

updatedAt.description: The date and time of the last update to the email, in ISO8601 representation.

VersionPublicEmail.description: Model definition for a marketing email version. Contains metadata describing the version of the marketing email. It can be used to view edit history of a marketing email.

fullName.description: First and last name of the user.

VersionUser.description: Model definition for a version user. Contains addition information about the user who created a version.

CollectionResponseWithTotalEmailStatisti.description: Response object for collections of EmailStatisticIntervals.

PublicEmailRecipients.description: Data structure representing lists of IDs that should be included and excluded.

correlationId.description: A unique identifier for the request. Include this value with any error reports or support tickets

links.description: A map of link names to associated URIs containing documentation about the error or recommended remediation steps

message.description: A human readable message describing the error along with remediation steps where appropriate

subCategory.description: A specific category that contains more specific detail about the error

example.message: Invalid input (details will vary based on the error)

cloneName.description: The name to assign to the cloned email.

language.description: The language code for the cloned email, such as 'en' for English.

abSampleSizeDefault.description: Version of the email that should be sent if there are too few recipients to conduct an AB test.

abSamplingDefault.description: Version of the email that should be sent if the results are inconclusive after the test period, master or variant.

abSuccessMetric.description: Metric to determine the version that will be sent to the remaining contacts.

abTestPercentage.description: The size of your test group.

hoursToWait.description: Time limit on gathering test results. After this time is up, the winning version will be sent to the remaining contacts.

testId.description: The ID of the AB test.

PublicEmailTestingDetails.description: AB testing related data. This property is only returned for AB type emails.

qualifierStats.description: Number of emails that were dropped and bounced.

PublicRssEmailDetails.description: RSS related data if it is a blog or rss email.

emails.description: List of email IDs that were sent during the time span.

AggregateEmailStatistics.description: Aggregated statistics for the given interval, plus the IDs of emails that were sent during that interval.

before.description: The cursor token value to get the previous set of results. Use this value as query parameter (&before=...) to obtain the previous page.

link.description: The link to the previous page.

PreviousPage.description: Contains information about the previous page.

customReplyTo.description: The reply to recipients will see.

replyTo.description: The from address and reply to email address (if no customReplyTo defined) recipients will see.

PublicEmailFromDetails.description: Data structure representing the from fields on the email.

after.description: The cursor token value to get the next set of results. Use this value as query parameter (&after=...) to obtain the next page.

link.description: The link to the previous page.

NextPage.description: Contains information about the next page.

SmartEmailField.description: An email field whose value is controlled by one or more smart rules.

end.description: The end timestamp of the interval, in ISO8601 format.

start.description: The start timestamp of the interval, in ISO8601 format.

PublicEmailContent.description: Data structure representing the content of the email.
